coverTitle: The Country Mouse and the City Mouse (Full Version)

pages.title: Page 1
pages.text: Once there were two mice. One lived in the country. One lived in the city. They were cousins. One day, Country Mouse invited City Mouse to visit. "Come see my home!" he said. "It is simple, but nice."

pages.title: Page 2
pages.text: City Mouse took the train. She rode first class! When she arrived, Country Mouse met her at the corner of the field. "Welcome!" he said. "Come, I will show you my home!" They walked through tall grass. Birds chirped. The sun was warm.

pages.title: Page 3
pages.text: Country Mouse lived in a cozy burrow under a fir tree. Inside, it was simple. A bed of soft grass. A small table. "Sit!" said Country Mouse. "I will make us dinner!" He served seeds, corn, and fresh water.

pages.title: Page 4
pages.text: City Mouse looked at the food. She wrinkled her nose. "Is this all?" she said. "Just seeds and corn?" "Yes," said Country Mouse. "But it is fresh! I picked it this morning." City Mouse nibbled a seed. It was plain. "You poor thing," she said. "You must come visit me! I will show you how fancy mice live!"

pages.title: Page 5
pages.text: The next week, Country Mouse took the train to the city. He rode third class. City Mouse met him at the curb. Cars zoomed by! Horns honked! "This way!" said City Mouse. "Hurry! Don't get hurt!" Country Mouse's heart began to beat fast. The city was loud and busy!

pages.title: Page 6
pages.text: City Mouse lived in a grand house. She had a little hole in the wall behind the kitchen. Inside, her home was fancy! A soft cushion bed. A mirror. A tiny silver spoon! "Wow!" said Country Mouse. "This is very nice!" "Wait until you see dinner!" said City Mouse.

pages.title: Page 7
pages.text: That night, the mice snuck into the kitchen. The table was full of food! Cheese! Cake! Roast beef! Butter! Fresh bread! "Help yourself!" said City Mouse. Country Mouse's eyes grew wide. "I have never seen so much food!" He took a bite of cheese. It was delicious!

pages.title: Page 8
pages.text: Suddenly, the door burst open! A huge cat ran in! It was the house cat! "Run!" cried City Mouse. "Hurry! Turn here!" The mice ran as fast as they could! The cat chased them! It purred and licked its chops!

pages.title: Page 9
pages.text: The mice dove into the wall. They were safe. But Country Mouse's heart pounded. "That was close!" he gasped. "I almost got hurt!" "Oh, that happens all the time," said City Mouse calmly. "You get used to it." Country Mouse was very scared. His fur stood on end.

pages.title: Page 10
pages.text: "Let's go back and eat!" said City Mouse. "The cat will leave soon." But Country Mouse shook his head. "No thank you," he said. "I would rather eat plain seeds in peace than fancy food in fear." "I am going home," he said. "I miss my quiet burrow."

pages.title: Page 11
pages.text: Country Mouse took the train back home. He was happy to see his field again! Birds chirped. The grass swayed. It was quiet and safe. He ate his simple dinner of seeds and corn. No cat chased him. No danger. "This is the life for me," he said happily.

pages.title: Page 12
pages.text: THE END Better a simple life in safety than a fancy life in danger. Country Mouse chose peace over fancy food. And he was happy! Use a scared voice! - Draw & Write: Draw Country Mouse's burrow and City Mouse's fancy home. Which would you choose? - Billy's Connection: Billy the Goat lives a simple mountain life. He has fresh air, good friends, and safety. That's all he needs! Theme: Happiness comes from safety and peace, not from fancy things. Country Mouse chose a simple, safe life over a dangerous, fancy one. What matters most to you? Discussion: Would you rather have lots of toys but always be in trouble, or fewer toys but always be safe and happy?
